newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) sharply down.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) sharply down.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Wednesday, issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and they are annual percentage rates.
The central bank does not post volumes.
Traders said that the main factor was a rumour the People's Bank of China would soon cut bank interest rates. Central bank officials declined to comment.
Many members, including state banks, increased lending on the rumour, making the rates fall sharply, they said.
But some securities brokerages borrowed money heavily to speculate in the domestic A share market, they said.
The rumour of the interest rate cut made Shanghai's A share index end up 1.34 percent on Wednesday.
